speaker: AMBER LYNN
line: Now I lay me down to sleep I pray the lord my soul to keep. If I die before I wake, I pray the lord my soul to take. God bless Mommy. God bless Daddy and Grandma and Grandpa LaPierre and Grandma and Grandpa Dyson, and...

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Okay, okay, Amber Lynn. Bedtime. Come on. You grab Mike, okay? Hop in. Let's get you cozy, cozy, toasty, toasty. In the sack, snug as a bug.

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: Night-night, Little.

speaker: AMBER LYNN
line: Night, daddy. Night, mommy.

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Night, love. Headlights out, Amber Lynn.

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: That's a good girl.

speaker: MAN ON TV
line: Weapon on the floor!

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: This is great.

speaker: MAN ON TV
line: What is this trial I'm being put through?

speaker: MAN ON TV
line: A test of my love for you?

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: Billie?

speaker: (MORE OF MRS. LAPIERRE'S WRITING
line: " … my instructions will result in the execution of Amber Lynn.")

speaker: (MORE OF MRS. LAPIERRE'S WRITING
line: "Go to the police and I will strangle her and send you the body parts one by one. Tell a stray dog and you will never see her alive again. Don't do anything dumb. No one shoots at Santa Claus.")

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: Billie! Amber Lynn!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Amber Lynn LaPierre, that's right. A federal investigation is underway... Of a kidnapping in Sacramento, California.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why are you here, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want this case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm fairly certain I've got more than enough competent Agents in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ooh, I can see that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is a kidnapping, Agent Mulder. A little girl snatched from her bedroom. Basic missionary-style FBI work. It's not an X-File.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm aware of the facts.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We're trying to rule out all possibilities before we start making any statements.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what I'm talking about-- ruling out other possibilities.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't just give you the case. I have to follow protocol. Behavioral gets first crack, then the people down at N.C.M.E.C.

speaker: MULDER
line: Two, three, four hours-- this case is going to be a circus. Every starstruck attorney in America is going to want to represent these people for free. If somebody doesn't ask the right questions right now they may never get asked.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You've got till noon. Mulder... the agents in my office... they have a pool going.

speaker: MULDER
line: They think she's dead. Don't bet on it.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Make room, make room. Back it up. Back it up. Come on, a little more, sir. A little more.

speaker: REPORTER
line: Excuse me, have they found the girl? Are there any new developments in the case? Is she dead?

speaker: REPORTER 2
line: Are the parents suspects in the disappearance of their daughter?

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: Sorry, no press allowed inside.

speaker: MULDER
line: Special Agent Fox Mulder, FBI. I'd like to speak to Mr. and Mrs. LaPierre, if I may.

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: My clients have nothing to say. Uh... Harry Bring. How can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Bring, your … your card says "real estate law and conveyances." Have you ever handled a murder case?

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: This isn't a murder case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it might as well be once the facts about Amber Lynn's disappearance get out.

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: My clients are not murderers and … and I resent any such accusation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. If you really want to help your clients, Mr. Bring get them a real lawyer.

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: It's okay, Harry.

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: Billie and I got nothing to hide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. And Mrs. LaPierre, my name is Fox Mulder. I'm a Special Agent with the FBI and I have a lot of experience with crimes like the one that took place here. I know you've made a statement to the police but I'd like to ask you some questions about that and I'd like you to answer in as much detail as both you and your lawyer are comfortable with. I want to ask you about the note you found. Where did you find it?

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: In my daughter's bedroom.

speaker: MULDER
line: When?

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: When I went to check on her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Um, do you know what time that was?

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: 9:30, I think. Right-right about then. I was watching TV in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What were you watching?

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: I never heard of it before. It was good.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about you, Mrs. LaPierre?

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: I was in bed already.

speaker: MULDER
line: Were you asleep?

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Half.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that Amber Lynn's bedroom that I saw down the hallway there?

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you always lock your doors at night even if you're home?

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know most of your neighbors, I bet up and down the street. You're on good terms with them?

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: Most of them, yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you think of anyone that might have wanted to hurt Amber Lynn?

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: No.

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: That's enough questions. They've been very helpful but I think you can see these folks have nothing whatsoever to hide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. and Mrs. LaPierre, I want you to understand something because it's going to get very confusing from here on in. But whatever else the FBI says or does they're going to try their damndest to find your little girl.

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Agent Mulder... do you think they will? Find her?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I hope so. Yeah... I really do.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's open.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Thinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About?

speaker: MULDER
line: Amber Lynn LaPierre.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mind if I turn on a light?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. I do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Skinner is royally pissed. At you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure he is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He expected a report at noon. He waited. Now he sent me to find you, to get it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't have a report.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They had to move on the case. The media got wind of the police findings and they're going to broadcast them. The parents are being held for further questioning.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're not guilty, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The facts would say otherwise. There's no sign of a break-in. Both parents were home when the girl disappeared.

speaker: MULDER
line: They lied about where they found the note.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what I've been thinking about.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it the media or just our own morbid fascination with the killing of an innocent?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's not dead, Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Fox? It's me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom? Hi.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: I'm watching the news. That little girl in California-- you're out there, aren't you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. I am. Are you okay, Mom?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: When are you coming back here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I'm not sure. I... You know, I... I don't know.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Call when you get back, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, I will. Um, you take care, Mom, okay?

speaker: SKINNER
line: From the note we can and have determined several facts. There is a threat of physical violence but no demand for money or ransom. The note is short and written on a torn piece of paper suggesting haste and little or no planning.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The paper's a type used by dry cleaners to protect laundered garments. The torn piece the note was found on matches exactly a piece that was found in the garbage at the LaPierre home. The ink matches a felt tip pen that was also found in the garbage. One set of prints were found on it-- Billie LaPierre's prints.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it her handwriting?

speaker: AGENT FLAGLER
line: That's going to be difficult to prove due to the felt tip pen and the quality of the paper which tends to cause bleeding and makes the handwriting indistinct. It also looks like there's been an attempt to disguise the writing. By using samples of Mrs. LaPierre's handwriting, you see dominant letter forms-- the "s" in "strangle..." "Stray dog..." Here in "Santa Claus..." matches up with the S's in "dollars..." "Seven" and "cents."

speaker: AGENT FLAGLER
line: Enough to make a connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: But not an indictment.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you have information you'd like to share with us, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Bud LaPierre says he'd been watching television and had gotten up to go to bed when he found Amber Lynn missing. But according to the police report the TV set was still on when the first officers arrived on the scene. By his own account both mother and father put Amber Lynn to bed and were never more than 20 feet from her room during the period in which she was abducted. The LaPierres know all their neighbors up and down the street -- are on good terms with them. But no one saw a stranger on a Friday at a fairly early hour enter into a locked and lighted home and remove this little girl undetected.

speaker: AGENT FLAGLER
line: Husband's lying for his wife.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think so.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because that doesn't explain what happened to this little girl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's something in that abduction note that I've seen before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not what I mean. You're personalizing this case. You're identifying with your sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: My sister was taken by aliens. Did I say anything about aliens, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are a lot of good agents up there in Skinner's office who do not have the patience for this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did I do? I provided a logical counterpoint.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You told them that they were wrong, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: And they are. Don't do anything dumb. No one shoots at Santa Claus.")

speaker: MULDER
line: Pocatello, Idaho, 1987. Look familiar?

speaker: GUARD
line: Kathy Lee. Visitors are here.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Oh, can you let them in, please?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, Miss Tencate, my name is Agent Mulder. This is Agent Scully. Will you have a seat?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: It's not the Ritz.

speaker: MULDER
line: Um, we just have a few questions. We've reviewed the facts of your case and the facts seem to speak for themselves. Your six-year-old son, Dean, was taken from his bed while he slept. A note was found threatening his life later determined to be written by you. You plead innocent at trial but you were convicted and sentenced to 12 years even though your son's body was never found.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Yes, that's right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your story is that, uh on the night your son disappeared you had a vision of him dead, but you thought it was your mind playing tricks on you but when you got up to check on him he was missing from his bed. Is that accurate?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, three years ago after seven years of incarceration, you changed your story and confessed to the murder of your son in a fit of insanity. A psychotic break.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Yes, that's right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why did you do it?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I don't know. I was full of rage.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a, uh, copy of the note that you wrote. Do you mind if I show it to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Now there's a phrase down here at the bottom. "No one shoots at Santa Claus." Can you explain what that means to me?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Uh, it means, that, uh... when someone promises you something, a gift-- like Santa Claus-- that no one would do anything for fear of not getting the gift.

speaker: MULDER
line: A little girl disappeared from her bed three days ago. This is a note that was left at that scene. Will you take a look at that and tell me what it says at the bottom?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Same thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Neither note makes a specific demand. In both cases, there's no evidence of foul play or a break-in. And as in your son's case there's no body to be found.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I told them where the body was.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, you did, but, uh, it wasn't where you said it was going to be.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I can't explain it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you can.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I can't.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can't explain it because you didn't do anything. You didn't kill your son and you didn't bury him. You're not guilty of anything other than a lie just like these people. The only reason you changed your story was to get out of here because you knew the parole board might buy the story of a psychotic break and of your terrible remorse but they would never, never let a woman out of jail who claimed her son just disappeared out of thin air. Now, these people, they need someone to tell them it's okay. Someone to corroborate their story.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I'm not that person.

speaker: MULDER
line: They need your help.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That was utterly irresponsible, Mulder. It was out of line and it was without any basis in reality.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think that woman could have killed her son?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was convicted in a court of law.

speaker: MULDER
line: So how do you explain those two notes written ten years apart could contain the same obscure phrase?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't explain it, Mulder, but you're doing exactly what I said. You're personalizing this case.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm going to solve this case. I am going to solve it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to find those kids.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if they're dead, Mulder? Don't go looking for something you don't want to find.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Guard. Guard, please can you get them back? Guard! I need to talk.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Fox Mulder. Leave a message. I'll try to get back to you.

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: Fox, it's your mother. I'd hoped you'd call upon your return but I haven't heard from you. I'm sure you're busy. There are so many emotions in me I wouldn't know where to start. So much that I've left unsaid for reasons I hope one day you'll understand.

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: This is highly unusual.

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: I want to know what you're doing here.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's something I want your clients to see.

speaker: HARRY BRING
line: I want to know what it is first.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't shoot at Santa Claus, Mr. Bring. You're going to want to see it, too. I believe you share a secret.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I'm, uh... I'm doing this because I feel that it's the right thing to do and because I know what you're going through and I wouldn't want to happen to you what happened to me. I just want to tell you that your little girl is okay. And I know you're afraid of the truth because I saw things that I was afraid of, too and I can't explain all of it except to say that I don't remember... Ever... Thinking those words that I wrote, let along writing them. It was like they wrote themselves using my hand. But, um, what I know … for sure because I feel it in my heart is that my son is safe and protected and in a better place.

speaker: NEWSCASTER
line: Rumors and suspicions aside the parents of Amber Lynn LaPierre were released today for lack of evidence against them and after giving a new statement to the Sacramento police which insiders say has authorities still baffled and confused recounting a detailed story that claims supernatural forces were at work when their daughter was abducted. The LaPierres, seen here returning to their home declined comment...

speaker: MULDER
line: ...Federal investigation of the case will continue but will no longer focus on the LaPierres as primary suspects. We, uh, we will intensify our search for Amber Lynn and we remain hopeful of her eventual safe return.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Intensify our search where? The twilight zone?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a corroborating witness.

speaker: SKINNER
line: In state prison.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's a material connection between these two women.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The only connection, Agent Mulder, is you. I've got people busting their butts on this thing, Agent Mulder. Putting together hard evidence, real evidence while you're out gathering Grimm's Fairy Tales from convicted murderers.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn't make sense. It's incomprehensible in any kind of a real world way.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I deal in the real world, Agent Mulder. You begged onto this case as part of the solution. All you've done is hand our only suspects the Twinkie Defense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What? What is it, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to have a word with Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It can wait.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it can't, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, your mom's dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Over here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Diazepam. She used them to sleep.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was there a note?

speaker: MULDER
line: She called when I was in California. She wanted to talk, but, uh... I never called her back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh... Why would she do this? It just doesn't make any sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We never truly know why.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, she wouldn't kill herself. Why are these pictures gone? There were photos here. There were photos of my sister and I. This is all that she had left of us and they're missing. Why...?

speaker: MULDER
line: She saw me on the news. She wanted to talk about the missing girl, Amber Lynn. She wanted to tell me something about her, or maybe she couldn't tell me over the phone because she was afraid that they would do something like this to her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoever took my sister. Look at this place. I mean, it's like... it's-it's all staged-- the pills, the oven, the tape. It's like a bad movie script. They would … they would have come here and they would have threatened her. She would be upset; they would have to sedate her. I would look for a, uh... a needle puncture mark or something else in her system besides these pills.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, no, Mulder. Please don't ask me to do this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, who else can I ask?

speaker: SCULLY
line: An autopsy, Mulder? I mean, it's one thing on a stranger but you're my friend, and she's your mother...

speaker: MULDER
line: I know, but if you don't do it, I might never know the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: You've seen things. I need to understand them.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Something's happened to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: My mother is dead. You know why.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, I can help you. I can talk to the parole board for you. But right now, I need you to help me.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I don't understand what you want.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not here by accident. My sister was taken away from me … when she was eight years old... like your son was taken away from you.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Where's your sister now?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Your mother knew, didn't she?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why do you ask that?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: She was trying to tell you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me what?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: She'd seen them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: The walk-ins. Old souls looking for new homes. Your sister's among them.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can see them?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Yes. But sometimes it's very difficult because they live in the starlight.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is my sister dead?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: They took her to protect her soul from the great harm it would have suffered in her life just like they did my little boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where do they take them? Your boy? This little girl, Amber Lynn LaPierre?

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: I don't know. But they're okay. I'm sure your sister's there, too.

speaker: LITTLE GIRL
line: That's not Rudolph.

speaker: YOUNG BOY
line: Do they all have names?

speaker: LITTLE GIRL
line: Is not. Is not.

speaker: YOUNG BOY
line: Rudolph the red-nosed reindeer had a very shiny nose

speaker: CHILDREN
line: Like a light bulb! Red-nosed reindeer!

speaker: YOUNG BOY
line: You can't say it.

speaker: LITTLE GIRL
line: Yes, I could.

speaker: YOUNG BOY
line: No, you can't.

speaker: LITTLE GIRL
line: I could.

speaker: YOUNG BOY
line: No, you can't.

speaker: WORLD WEARY DAD
line: Hey, buddy. The kids want to see Santa. What about it?

speaker: PAUNCHY MAN
line: He's just flying in.

speaker: LITTLE GIRL
line: We're going to see Santa!

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: Fox, it's your mother. I'd hoped you'd call upon your return but I haven't heard from you. I'm sure you're busy. There are... so many emotions in me I wouldn't know where to start. So much that I've left unsaid, for reasons I hope one day you'll understand.

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: There are... so many emotions in me I wouldn't know where to start. So much that I've left unsaid for reasons I hope one day you'll understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm glad you're here. My mother was trying to tell me something. I think I figured it out. It's something about my sister that she was never able to tell me.

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: So much that I've left unsaid for reasons I hope one day you'll understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: She knew what I'd find with this case out in California.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How could she know that, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: A child disappearing without a trace-- without evidence-- in defiance of all logical explanation? She knew because of what's driven me-- what I've always believed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, these parents who've lost... … who've lost their children... They've had visions of their sons and daughters in scenarios that never happened but which they describe in notes that came through them as automatic writing and words that came through them psychically from old souls protecting the children. My mother must have written a note like that herself. Describing the scenario of my sister's disappearance of her, of her abduction by aliens. Don't you see, Scully? It never happened. All these visions that I've had have just been... they've been to help me cope, to help me deal with the loss but... I've been looking for my sister in the wrong place. That's... what my mother was trying to tell me. That's what she was trying to warn me about. That's why they killed her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your mother killed herself, Mulder. I conducted the autopsy. She was dying of an incurable disease. An untreatable and horribly disfiguring disease called Paget's Carcinoma. She knew it. There were doctor's records. She didn't want to live.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder …

speaker: MULDER
line: She was trying to tell me something. She was......trying to tell me something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, she was trying to tell you to stop. To stop looking for your sister. She was just trying to take away your pain.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How's he doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's been a hard night for him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Billie LaPierre is asking for him. She's got something to say and she'll only talk to Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not a good...

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: This case has heated up. I've booked two flights for us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then you better book three.

speaker: MR. LAPIERRE
line: Honey, wake up. He's here. Come in, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's okay. She's here to help. What happened here, Billie?

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: I saw my daughter right in this room.

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: Standing right there. I swear to god. She was right over there in the pajamas her grandma gave her... saying something to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was she saying?

speaker: MRS. LAPIERRE
line: I don't know. Her lips were moving but I couldn't hear. I thought... I thought she was saying "74."

speaker: MULDER
line: "74"? The number 74? Does that mean anything to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: 74 mean anything to you, Mr. LaPierre?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we just got here.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're not going to find these people's daughter alive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know that?

speaker: MULDER
line: What we're hearing-- it's the delusional talk of people that don't want to accept the truth.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You think they know what happened to their child?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe, maybe not but you can't see a ghost and still hope to find her alive. Both things can't be true. And if this little girl's spirit really did appear to her mother then there's probably only one explanation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You think their daughter's dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what about the handwritten note?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know what that means. I don't know what is the truth and what isn't anymore. I'm way too close to this case to make any kind of sound judgment. In fact, I would like to ask for you to let me off this case, please, and I'd like to take some time off.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Santa Claus.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop. Turn around.

speaker: MULDER
line: Some of these tapes go back to the '60s.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I know what we're going to find here. It's what my mother was afraid of. My sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's Amber Lynn LaPierre. This tape was dated two days before her disappearance.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hey!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Stop!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Keep your hands up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's your name?

speaker: PAUNCHY MAN
line: Ed... Scruloff...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're under arrest. You have the right to remain silent. If you give up the right to remain silent anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law. You have the right to speak with an attorney and to have the attorney present during questioning. If you so desire...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully.
